dt: {bc}a vehicle usually on runners for transportation especially on snow or ice
{bc}a small steerable one used especially by children for coasting down snow-covered hills

et: Middle English {it}sledde{/it}, from Middle Dutch; akin to Old English {it}slīdan{/it} to slide
shortdef: a vehicle usually on runners for transportation especially on snow or ice; especially : a small steerable one used especially by children for coasting down snow-covered hills

dt: {bc}to ride on a sled or sleigh

shortdef: to ride on a sled or sleigh

dt: {bc}a dog (such as a Siberian husky or Alaskan malamute) trained to draw a usually heavy sled typically with other dogs over snow-covered terrain

Sled dogs were originally used in colder regions (as of northern Canada, Alaska, Greenland, and Antarctica) as work dogs to facilitate travel and transport of supplies but are now popularly used elsewhere during the winter especially for racing.

shortdef: a dog (such as a Siberian husky or Alaskan malamute) trained to draw a usually heavy sled typically with other dogs over snow-covered terrain —Sled dogs were originally used in colder regions (as of northern Canada, Alaska, Greenland, and Antarctica) as work dogs to facilitate travel and transport of supplies but are now popularly used elsewhere during the winter especially for racing.

dt: {bc}a rocket-propelled vehicle that runs usually on a single rail and that is used especially in aeronautical experimentation

shortdef: a rocket-propelled vehicle that runs usually on a single rail and that is used especially in aeronautical experimentation
